name: .BKF File Extension
summary: Learn about .BKF files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: A BKF file is a backup file created using Windows Backup Utility, which is included with Windows NT and XP Pro (located in Programs → Accessories → System Tools). It contains a catalog of one or more files that a user chose to preserve.

content: BKF files can be restored to Windows Server 2008 and Windows Vista systems using the Windows NT Backup - Restore Utility.

You can also restore files from a BKF catalog in Windows 7, 8, and 10 with NTBackup (it is titled "nt5backup.cab" on the download page). Select "Restore files and settings" in the "Backup or Restore" wizard, select Browse..., navigate to the BKF file, click OK.
NOTE: Windows Backup Utility must be installed from the XP Home installation disc to be used with Windows XP Home Edition.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
